TypeSignature.Value: .class nested public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit VisualStyleElement/ToolBar/SeparatorVertical extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides a for a vertical separator of the toolbar. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.ToolBar.SeparatorVertical.Normal%2A> property of the VisualStyleElement.ToolBar.SeparatorVertical class returns a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> that represents a vertical separator of the toolbar.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.ToolBar.SeparatorVertical.Normal%2A> property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementToolBarSeparatorVertical1` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#271](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/0533eb65-553a-4922-b453-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#271](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/0533eb65-553a-4922-b453-_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets a visual style element that represents a vertical separator of the toolbar.
Docs.value: A that represents a vertical separator of the toolbar.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Normal property to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Normal property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementToolBarSeparatorVertical1` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#271](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/f9261c64-2378-4e08-84e5-_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#271](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/f9261c64-2378-4e08-84e5-_1.vb)]
